Hi Drew, I would lean towards assigning random fitness values.  If you as=
sign everything an identical fitness, then in some NEAT implementation it i=
s likely that the last offspring created will be the ones that don't reprod=
uce because the individuals will be sorted by their order of creation (give=
n that they all have the same fitness).  So it is kind of un-random to alwa=
ys choose the earliest-created, though in practice it probably isn't any di=
fferent from any other kind of random process.

Note that in both cases, yo=
u will still have the protection provided by speciation (i.e. so that more =
unusual genotypes don't require the same level of fitness to survive).  How=
ever, since that is true in normal NEAT as well, it still isolates the issu=
e of the impact of fitness.

ken
